bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 110 (Friday, July 1, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. FALLON:H.R. 8267.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, U.S. Constitution.[Page H5930]

item.title: Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023

latestAction.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 392.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Intelligence (Permanent Select).

summary.text:
Container Missile Notification Act

This bill requires the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI) to notify Congress if the intelligence community receives intelligence that Russia, China, Iran, or North Korea is deploying (or about to deploy) a missile launcher disguised as or concealed in a shipping container. Currently, ODNI is only required to notify Congress about intelligence that Russia is deploying the Club-K container missile system.

bill.title: Container Missile Notification Act

item.title: To amend the Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2016 to ensure that Congress is notified of the deployment or transfer of containerized missile systems by Russia, China, or Iran.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Intelligence (Permanent Select).

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
